leaders.definition: High DCI (>0.5 SD) + High Institutions (>0.5 SD)

policy_strategy.description: Leverage advanced digital infrastructure to develop green technology exports while achieving absolute decoupling
key_actions: Invest in next-generation digital infrastructure (5G/6G, edge computing)
Develop green tech export industries (smart grids, energy storage, carbon capture)
Implement carbon pricing to complement digital efficiency gains
Lead international standards for digital sustainability
Focus on absolute decoupling, not just relative efficiency

expected_impact.timeline: 3-5 years for domestic, 5-10 years for export impact

catch_up.definition: Medium DCI (-0.5 to 0.5 SD) + Medium Institutions (-0.5 to 0.5 SD)

policy_strategy.description: Maximize decarbonization returns through targeted digital infrastructure investment combined with institutional strengthening
key_actions: Prioritize digital infrastructure in high-emission sectors (industry, transport, buildings)
Bundle digital investment with institutional reforms
Leverage international climate finance for digital projects
Focus on quick wins: smart grids, industrial efficiency, digital agriculture
Develop local digital capacity to avoid technology dependency

expected_impact.note: Highest marginal returns to digital investment

potential.definition: Low DCI (<-0.5 SD) + High Institutions (>0.5 SD)

policy_strategy.description: Build digital infrastructure to unlock decarbonization potential enabled by strong institutions
key_actions: Accelerate digital infrastructure deployment (fiber, 5G, data centers)
Leverage strong institutions for rapid deployment
Focus on sector-specific applications (offshore wind, circular economy)
Develop digital skills to match infrastructure
Create regulatory frameworks for digital energy markets

expected_impact.note: Strong institutions enable rapid scaling once infrastructure is in place

struggling.definition: Low DCI (<-0.5 SD) + Low Institutions (<-0.5 SD)

policy_strategy.description: Require substantial international support combining digital infrastructure with institutional development
key_actions: Prioritize basic connectivity and electricity access
Bundle digital projects with governance reforms
Leverage multilateral development bank financing
Focus on adaptation co-benefits (early warning, climate resilience)
Build local capacity for technology operation and maintenance

expected_impact.note: Lower returns require patient capital and comprehensive support

exceptions.definition: High DCI + High Institutions but weaker than expected effects

characteristics.note: These countries show weaker DCI effects due to high EDS (External Digital Specialization) or already-clean energy systems
characteristics.high_eds_factor: Service export orientation may dampen domestic efficiency gains
characteristics.renewable_factor: Already high renewable share reduces marginal carbon savings from digitalization

policy_strategy.description: Shift from efficiency gains to absolute emission reductions through system transformation
key_actions: Focus on absolute emission caps rather than efficiency improvements
Address structural factors (high EDS) through sectoral policies
Invest in breakthrough technologies (green hydrogen, CCS)
Lead on international climate finance and technology transfer
Develop circular economy models

expected_impact.note: These countries need different policy approaches as standard DCI investments show diminishing returns

energy_efficiency.policy_implications: Digital investments should prioritize measurable energy efficiency improvements
energy_efficiency.measurement: Track energy intensity alongside digital adoption

institutional_quality.policy_implications: Digital investments must be paired with governance reforms

renewable_energy.policy_implications: Digital investment priority should be inverse to current renewable share
renewable_energy.optimal_context: Countries with 20-50% renewable share see strongest DCI effects

sdg_7.name: Affordable and Clean Energy
sdg_7.contribution: Direct: Digital infrastructure enables renewable integration and grid optimization
sdg_7.quantified_impact: 11.7% of DCI effect through energy efficiency improvements

sdg_9.name: Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure
sdg_9.contribution: Direct: DCI measures infrastructure capacity; supports industrial digitalization
sdg_9.quantified_impact: Middle-income countries see 2.17 tons CO2 reduction per DCI unit

sdg_12.name: Responsible Consumption and Production
sdg_12.contribution: Indirect: Digital tracking enables circular economy and resource efficiency
sdg_12.quantified_impact: Structural change accounts for -9.5% of effect (negative due to rebound)

sdg_13.name: Climate Action
sdg_13.contribution: Direct: -1.91 tons CO2/capita per DCI unit (IV estimate)
